creator: u36674300@bedug.com
text:
The error log contains a "wild" number of threads to terminate.

My environment:
Windows 2000 Advanced Server SP3 with all patches until today (October 19, 2002)
ZoneAlarm 3.1.395
Apache 2.0.43 started as a service.

The system didn't seem to be able to stop the Apache service  (I had to reset
the computer to be able to get it out clean!)

There have also been a situation with a blue screen.

To me it seems like a variable containing the number of threads in use is either
overwritten, or not initialized correctly.

The error log contains the following:

[Sat Oct 19 09:15:02 2002] [notice] Parent: Received shutdown signal -- Shutting
down the server.
[Sat Oct 19 09:15:02 2002] [notice] Child 780: Exit event signaled. Child
process is ending.
[Sat Oct 19 09:15:03 2002] [notice] Child 780: Released the start mutex
[Sat Oct 19 09:15:07 2002] [notice] Child 780: Waiting for 250 worker threads to
exit.
[Sat Oct 19 09:15:32 2002] [notice] Parent: Forcing termination of child process
272 
[Sat Oct 19 09:18:07 2002] [notice] Child 780: Terminating 1878053824 threads
that failed to exit.
[Sat Oct 19 09:18:07 2002] [notice] Child 780: All worker threads have exited.
[Sat Oct 19 09:18:07 2002] [notice] Child 780: Child process is exiting

creator: dpejesh@yahoo.com
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 7932 ***
